trans-unit.source: Go back to Visual Studio and select the Shared Code Client App project (it is named like `<your app name>.Shared`)
trans-unit.target: Go back to Visual Studio and select the Shared Code Client App project (it is named like `<your app name>.Shared`)

trans-unit.source: Expand the **App.xaml** file and then open the **App.xaml.cs** file.
trans-unit.target: Expand the **App.xaml** file and then open the **App.xaml.cs** file.

trans-unit.source: Locate the declaration of the `MobileService` member which is initialized with a localhost URL.
trans-unit.target: Locate the declaration of the `MobileService` member which is initialized with a localhost URL.

trans-unit.source: Comment out this declaration (with `CTRL+K,CTRL+C`) and uncomment the declaration (`CTRL+K,CTRL+U`) that connects to your hosted service:
trans-unit.target: Comment out this declaration (with `CTRL+K,CTRL+C`) and uncomment the declaration (`CTRL+K,CTRL+U`) that connects to your hosted service:

trans-unit.source: Press the F5 key to rebuild the project and start the Windows Store app, which should be your default start up project.
trans-unit.target: Press the F5 key to rebuild the project and start the Windows Store app, which should be your default start up project.

trans-unit.source: In the app, type meaningful text, such as *Complete the tutorial*, in the **Insert a TodoItem** textbox, and then click **Save**.
trans-unit.target: In the app, type meaningful text, such as *Complete the tutorial*, in the **Insert a TodoItem** textbox, and then click **Save**.

trans-unit.source: This sends a POST request to the new mobile app backend hosted in Azure.
trans-unit.target: This sends a POST request to the new mobile app backend hosted in Azure.

trans-unit.source: Stop debugging and change the default start up project in the universal Windows solution to the Windows Phone Store app (right click the `<your app name>.WindowsPhone` project and click **Set as StartUp Project**) and press F5 again.
trans-unit.target: Stop debugging and change the default start up project in the universal Windows solution to the Windows Phone Store app (right click the `<your app name>.WindowsPhone` project and click **Set as StartUp Project**) and press F5 again.

trans-unit.source: Notice that data saved from the previous step is loaded from the mobile app after the Windows app starts.
trans-unit.target: Notice that data saved from the previous step is loaded from the mobile app after the Windows app starts.
